What happens if I lose control of my VerusID and want to recover my assets?

If you lose control of your VerusID, you can completely recover your assets into your own control using the revocation and recovery authorities. You can read more about how these authorities function to understand the process.

ompletely recover those assets into your own control. Read more here on how the revocation and recovery authorities function.
TimeLock & DelayLock
Vault has two different options to lock your assets, TimeLock and DelayLock. You can only choose one option to lock the Vault. And the only way to circumvent a locked Vault is through revoking and recovering the VerusID.
With TimeLock you determine how long you want the Vault to be locked. After the determined period is over the assets can be spent again. The maximum amount of time the Vault can be locked is 21 years.
With DelayLock you determine a cooldown period. You lock the Vault and have to request an unlock. After requesting the unlock you have to wait for the determined cooldown period before the assets can be spent again.

So how does it work? You can search for any VerusID on VaultAlert.net and it shows you all you need to know about the Vault status and more.

What are TimeLock and DelayLock, and how do they work in a Vault?

TimeLock and DelayLock are two options to lock your assets in a Vault. You can choose only one option to lock the Vault. With TimeLock, you determine how long you want the Vault to be locked, and after the determined period is over, the assets can be spent again. The maximum amount of time the Vault can be locked is 21 years. With DelayLock, you determine a cooldown period, lock the Vault, and then request an unlock. After requesting the unlock, you have to wait for the determined cooldown period before the assets can be spent again. The only way to circumvent a locked Vault is through revoking and recovering the VerusID.

What is VaultAlert.net, and how can it help me?

VaultAlert.net is a website where you can search for any VerusID to see the Vault status and more information about it. This can help you stay informed about the status of a particular Vault and make informed decisions.
